Activity

Decide if fiber is the best solution to a cabling requirement.

After each scenario, check either fiber optic or copper.

1. <textformat blockindent='13'>A company must provide network connectivity between three buildings on a single campus. The cables must be run outside and there is a high probability of lightning storms in the area.</textformat>
2. <textformat blockindent='13'>A company must provide network connectivity between two buildings located 1 km apart.</textformat>

3. <textformat blockindent='13'>A company must provide 100 Mbps connectivity to users located in their main office by running cables from the central switch to the individual desktops. The maximum distance from the switch to a workstation is 60 meters.</textformat>

Scenario 1
Answer: Fiber Optic (FO)
Fiber would be the appropriate choice here since copper media would carry the energy from a lightning strike into the buildings, possibly damaging network equipment. Fiber optic cable will not conduct electricity.

Scenario 2
Answer: Fiber Optic (FO)
For long runs fiber optic cable is more suited. Copper usually has more critical distance limitations requiring the installation of expensive repeaters to regenerate the signal as it becomes attenuated.

Scenario 3
Answer: Copper (UTP)
Copper is a much less expensive alternative than fiber to the desktop. The distance to individual stations is less than the maximum 100 m for UTP and the bandwidth required is within that available with Cat 5 or Cat 5e cable.
Incorrect, please review the scenarios and then try again.
